means: 好争斗的，借故生端的，爱打架的，要打架的

sentence.Network_en: He is respected as a very aggressive and competitive executive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一位锐意进取、竞争意识很强的主管，颇受尊敬。

sentence.Network_en: Her aggressive moods alternated with gentle or more co-operative states.
sentence.Network_cn: 她情绪多变，时而咄咄逼人，时而又显得温柔平和或乐于合作。

sentence.Network_en: It could be argued that the British are not aggressive enough.
sentence.Network_cn: 可以说英国人不够强势。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Latin aggress- 'attacked' (from the verb aggredi) + -ive; compare with French agressif, -ive

entry.def: An aggressive person or animal has a quality of anger and determination that makes them ready to attack other people.

example.ex: Some children are much more aggressive than others...
example.tran: 一些孩子比其他孩子更好斗。

entry.def: People who are aggressive in their work or other activities behave in a forceful way because they are very eager to succeed.

example.ex: He is respected as a very aggressive and competitive executive...
example.tran: 他是一位锐意进取、竞争意识很强的主管，颇受尊敬。

example.ex: The Zambian game is much more aggressive than European soccer.
example.tran: 赞比亚的这种运动比欧式足球要激烈得多。

means.word_mean: 1. having or showing determination and energetic pursuit of your ends;

sentences.sentence: "he was aggressive and imperious; positive in his convictions"

means.word_mean: 2. marked by aggressive ambition and energy and initiative;

sentences.sentence: "a pushing youth intent on getting on in the world"

means.word_mean: 4. characteristic of an enemy or one eager to fight;

stems_affixes.value_cn: 侵略的,好斗的,有进取心的,敢作敢为的
stems_affixes.word_buile: aggress[v.侵略,进攻]+ive……的→adj.侵略的,好斗的,有进取心的,敢作敢为的
progress[n.进步]+ive……的→adj.进步的,先进的;前进的
ag再+gress走+ion表名词→一再往前走→进攻

stems_affixes.value_cn: [代表]大会;[美国等国的]国会,议会
stems_affixes.word_buile: con一起+gress行走,步→走到一起→代表大会
de分开+gree=gress行走,步→分开走→级别→程度,度数

stems_affixes.value_cn: 离题, 脱轨, 扯到枝节上
stems_affixes.word_buile: digress[v.离题]+ion表名词→n.离题, 脱轨, 扯到枝节上

stems_affixes.value_cn: 违反, 犯罪, [地]海侵, 海进
stems_affixes.word_buile: transgress[v.冒犯;违背]+ion表名词→n.违反, 犯罪, [地]海侵, 海进

means.word_mean: 好争斗的, 挑衅的, 侵略性的

sentences.en: The dogs are trained to be aggressive.
sentences.cn: 这些狗被训练得具有攻击性。

jushi.english: His victory was largely a result of his aggressive election campaign.
jushi.chinese: 他的胜利很大程度上是他积极竞选的结果。

jushi.english: Thanks to our aggressive marketing tactics, our sales have risen sharply this year.
jushi.chinese: 由于我们积极的营销策略,我们今年的销售额急剧上升。

jushi.english: He is an aggressive person and likely to start a fight.
jushi.chinese: 他好攻击他人,随时准备打架。
